Full Map: Detroit, Dallas, Portland

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(leaflet)
library(DT)

filtered_MGG_GG <- read.csv("~/MGG-LC-Data/case-studies/filtered_MGG_GG.csv")

# Define a custom palette
custom_colors <- c(
  "Damron's Guide" = "#82e0aa",
  "Gaia's Guide" = "#a569bd"
)

color_palette <- colorFactor(
  palette = custom_colors,
  domain = filtered_MGG_GG$publication
)


# Create the map
map <- leaflet(data = filtered_MGG_GG) %>%
  addTiles() %>%  # Add default OpenStreetMap tiles
  addCircleMarkers(
    ~lon, ~lat,  # Longitude and Latitude
    color = ~color_palette(publication),  # Circle border color based on publication
    fillColor = ~color_palette(publication),  # Circle fill color based on publication
    fillOpacity = 0.7,
    radius = 8,  # Circle size
    popup = ~paste(
      "<b>Title:</b>", title,
      "<br><b>Type:</b>", type,
      "<br><b>Address:</b>", address,
      "<br><b>Publication:</b>", publication,
      "<br><b>City:</b>", city,
      "<br><b>State:</b>", state,
      "<br><b>Latitude:</b>", lat,
      "<br><b>Longitude:</b>", lon
    )  # Popup with additional fields
  ) %>%
  addLegend(
    position = "bottomright",
    pal = color_palette,
    values = ~publication,
    title = "Publication",
    opacity = 0.7
  )

# Create a paged table for unique titles
unique_titles <- filtered_MGG_GG %>%
  distinct(title, .keep_all = TRUE) %>%
  arrange(title)

table_data <- unique_titles[, c("title", "publication", "description", "address")]

paged_table <- datatable(
  table_data,
  options = list(pageLength = 10, scrollX = TRUE),
  rownames = FALSE,
  caption = "Dallas, Detroit, Portland Locations"
)

#view map/table
map
paged_table

```
